intro: Hieraciodes aspera, commonly known as rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features yellow flowers with a distinctive, rough, and hairy appearance, which gives it its common name. Its leaves are typically lobed and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rugged texture. Hieraciodes aspera is often found in dry grasslands and rocky habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
